Articles.Content:
Hello fellow Kerbanauts... iDisOrder!

 ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

I've been *playing* KSP for a while now and decided to finally try out some mods.

I know, what took me so long, right?

Well, most of the stuff in KSP intimidates the heck outta me so I was trying to get a feel of the vanilla game before attempting to mod it.

Also, I try watching as many videos as I can on mods that interest me before I decide if I want to use it.

I've finally decided to jump in and grab some of these wonderful mods to help enhance my game play.

I apologize in advance if I ask any silly questions here on the forums, but I'm old and my mind can't grasp to much of this at once.

Thanks to all the people smarter than myself who made such wonderful mods!!!

Hello welcome to the forums. Mods can be loads of fun just be careful how much you install, the more you have the slower the game is (Most likely) and prone to crash. Can't wait to see your spacecrafts in the spacecraft exchange. 

Happy Flying.

Hello iDisOrder, and welcome to the forums! There are many, many great mods out there. I've only tried a few myself.

There are many silly questions asked on the forums. Most of them, as well as most of the serious ones, have been answered it the [Gameplay Questions and Tutorials](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/forums/15-Gameplay-Questions-and-Tutorials) section of the forums where you'll find an enormous wealth of valuable information. Also, be sure to check out [the Wiki](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Main_Page), if you haven't already. Some of the info may still be slightly out-of-date, but it will be updated as quickly as the volunteers can manage and it is an essential resource for important reference information.

Happy landings!
